title: 106_s3
content:
The "Tax Cuts for All Americans Act" imposes a 10 percent reduction in individual income tax rates for married individuals filing joint returns and surviving spouses. This Act amends the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to lower tax rates. The tax rates based on taxable income are as follows:
- Not over $43,050: 13.5% of taxable income
- Over $43,050 but not over $104,050: $5,811.75 plus 25.2% of the excess over $43,050
- Over $104,050 but not over $158,550: $21,183.75 plus 27.9% of the excess over $104,050
- Over $158,550 but not over $283,150: $36,389.25 plus 32.4% of the excess over $158,550
- Over $283,150: $76,759.65 plus 35.64% of the excess over $283,150. Heads of Households are subject to a different tax table. The tax rates for unmarried individuals based on taxable income are as follows:
- Not over $34,550: 13.5% of taxable income
- Over $34,550 but not over $89,150: $4,664.25 plus 25.2% of the excess over $34,550
- Over $89,150 but not over $144,400: $18,423.45 plus 27.9% of the excess over $89,150
- Over $144,400 but not over $283,150: $33,838.20 plus 32.4% of the excess over $144,400
- Over $283,150: $78,793.20 plus 35.64% of the excess over $283,150. Tax is imposed on the taxable income of unmarried individuals, excluding surviving spouses or heads of households, based on a specified table. Tax is imposed on the taxable income of married individuals filing separate returns based on a specified table, with varying tax rates depending on income brackets. Tax is imposed on the taxable income of estates and trusts based on a specified table with varying tax rates depending on income brackets. Tax is imposed on the taxable income of estates and trusts based on a specified table with varying tax rates depending on income brackets. The tax rates range from 13.5% to 35.64% based on different income thresholds. Inflation adjustments have been made to update the tax brackets in the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to update various provisions by changing the year from 1992 to 1998 in multiple sections. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to update various provisions by changing the year from 1992 to 1998 in multiple sections, including sections 513, 685, 877, 911, 2032A, 2503, 2631, 4001, 4261, 6039F, 6323, 6601, and 7430. Additionally, section 1 of the Code is amended to change the percentage from 15% to 13.5%. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to update various provisions by changing percentages in different sections. For example, section 1 is amended to change the percentage from 15% to 13.5%, section 1(g)(7)(B)(ii)(II) is amended to change the percentage from 15% to 13.5%, section 1(h) is amended to change percentages from 28% to 25.2%, section 531 and 541 are amended to change percentages from 39.6% to 35.64%, and section 3402 is amended to change percentages from 7, 15, 28, or 31% to 7, 13.5, 25.2, or 27.9%. The Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended to update various provisions by changing percentages in different sections. For example, sections 3402(p)(2), 3402(q)(1), 3402(r)(3), and 3406(a)(1) are amended to change percentages from 31% to 27.9%, 28% to 25.2%, 31% to 27.9%, and 31% to 27.9% respectively. These amendments apply to taxable years beginning after December 31, 1998, with withholding provisions applying to amounts paid after the same date.
